required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Evaluating the Radial Reload Stapler With Tri-Staple TM Technology During Laparoscopic Low Anterior Resection for Rectal Cancer: A Prospective Multicenter Case Series

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the Radial Reload Stapler during laparoscopic low anterior resection (LAR) or anterior proctosigmoidectomy for rectal cancer by assessing the primary and secondary endpoints.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.description: The surgeon's ability to achieve a staple line at the desired level of the rectum.
The ability to achieve adequate distal margins (defined as >2cm [or >1cm with clear histologic evaluation]) in the low rectum.

secondary_outcome.description: Access measured by surgeon usability questionnaire. Visibility measured by surgeon usability questionnaire. Maneuverability measured by surgeon usability questionnaire.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Covidien Radial Reload Stapler with Tri-Staple Technology
arm_group.description: Covidien Radial Reload Stapler with Tri-Staple Technology in laparoscopic low anterior resection or proctosigmoidectomy.

intervention.intervention_name: Covidien Radial Reload Stapler with Tri-Staple Technology
intervention.description: Case series of patients already selected to undergo a laparoscopic LAR or proctosigmoidectomy using the Radial Reload Stapler
intervention.arm_group_label: Covidien Radial Reload Stapler with Tri-Staple Technology

study_pop.textblock: Patients undergoing laparoscopic LAR or proctosigmoidectomy for treatment of rectal cancer.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. The subject is able to understand and sign Informed Consent Form.
2. The subject is between 18-85 years of age.
3. The subject is anticipated to undergo a resection of the rectum with anastomosis below the peritoneal reflection.
4. The subject is anticipated to undergo mobilization and stapling of the rectum laparoscopically.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Any female patient, who is pregnant, suspected pregnant, or nursing.
2. The participant is unable or unwilling to comply with the study requirements, follow-up schedule.
3. The participant has co-morbidities which, in the opinion of the investigator, will not be appropriate for the study.
